It is defined by the W3C's XML 1.0 Specification and by several other related specifications, all of which are free open standards - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xml wikipedia]

synopsis: [[XPath]] wildcards can be used to select unknown [[XML]] nodes.

title: Regular expression

[[Philip Hazel]] started writing PCRE in summer 1997. PCRE's syntax is much more powerful and flexible than either of the [[regular expression#POSIX]] flavors and than that of many other regular-expression libraries.

title: Perl Compatible Regular Expressions
synopsis: Perl Compatible Regular Expressions ([[PCRE]]) is a library written in C, which implements a regular expression engine, inspired by the capabilities of the Perl programming language. Philip Hazel started writing PCRE in summer 1997. PCRE's syntax is much more powerful and flexible than either of the POSIX regular expression flavors and than that of many other regular-expression libraries. - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perl_Compatible_Regular_Expressions wikipedia]
